definitions.definition: A liquid which converts lead to gold .
A substance or liquid which is believed to cure all ills and give eternal life.
The alleged cure for all ailments ; cure-all , panacea .
A sweet flavored liquid (usually containing a small amount of alcohol) used in compounding medicines to be taken by mouth in order to mask an unpleasant taste.

main_definition: ( alchemy ) A liquid which converts lead to gold .
secondary_definitions: ( alchemy ) A substance or liquid which is believed to cure all ills and give eternal life.
( by extension ) The alleged cure for all ailments ; cure-all , panacea .
( pharmacy ) A sweet flavored liquid (usually containing a small amount of alcohol) used in compounding medicines to be taken by mouth in order to mask an unpleasant taste.
